adept.module
Class AbstractModule

java.lang.Object
  adept.module.AbstractModule
All Implemented Interfaces:
IModule
Direct Known Subclasses:
AcousticInteractionAnalyzer, AnomalousTextDetector, CommittedBeliefTagger, ConversationAnnotator, CoreferenceResolver, EntityMentionDetector, EventCoreferenceResolver, JointCoreferenceRelationExtractor, NamedEntityTagger, NoveltyDetector, OpinionTagger, PosTagger, RelationExtractor, SarcasmDetector, SentenceSimilarityDetector, SocialEventExtractor, SpeechSegmentor, SyntacticChunker, TextualEntailmentDetector, UncertaintyDetector
public abstract class AbstractModule
extends Object
implements IModule

The Class AbstractModule is an abstract definition of an algorithm module that implements the IModule interface. The overridden methods will have generic implementations to handle activation, initialization and deactivation of ADEPT algorithm modules

activate

public void activate(String configFilePath)
              throws InvalidPropertiesFormatException,
                     IOException,
                     AdeptModuleException
Description copied from interface: IModule
Activate. Activates the algorithm and perform one or more following tasks: 1. Parse the config and initialize member variables 2. Allocate memory for buffers, lists, maps, etc. 3. Set up database connections and file I/O pointers

Specified by:
activate in interface IModule
Parameters:
configFilePath - the config file path
Throws:
InvalidPropertiesFormatException - the invalid properties format exception
IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
AdeptModuleException - the adept module exception

deactivate

public void deactivate()
                throws AdeptModuleException
Description copied from interface: IModule
Deactivate. This method will signal a shutdown to the algorithm. All the allocated members and connections will be cleared through this invocation.

Specified by:
deactivate in interface IModule
Throws:
AdeptModuleException - the adept module exception
